block.p: DELPHI, Troy, Mich., the world's largest maker of automotive parts, said it had won a five-year, $60 million contract to provide systems that control air and fuel flow in motorcycle engines to Chongqing Zongsheng Motorcycle Group, China.
PROVELL, Minneapolis, a direct marketing company, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, listing $40.5 million in assets and more than $82.9 million in debts.

DELPHI, Troy, Mich., the world's largest maker of automotive parts, said it had won a five-year, $60 million contract to provide systems that control air and fuel flow in motorcycle engines to Chongqing Zongsheng Motorcycle Group, China.
PROVELL, Minneapolis, a direct marketing company, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, listing $40.5 million in assets and more than $82.9 million in debts.

CHEMED, Cincinnati, owner of Roto-Rooter, the plumbing and drain-cleaning service, agreed to sell Patient Care, its home health care services unit, to a group of investors led by Shroder Ventures Life Sciences Group, for $70 million in cash.

LOUISIANA-PACIFIC, Portland, Ore., a maker of building materials, said it planned to sell up to $700 million worth of its properties over the next 12 to 18 months to pay down debt. The company also expects to close 25 to 30 of its 60 mills and reduce its work force to 5,300 from 9,700.
